0: A charity shop is urging people to stop donating The Da Vinci Code after becoming overwhelmed with copies. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Oxfam shop in Swansea has been receiving an average of one copy of the Dan Brown novel a week for months, leaving them with little room for any other books. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Staff who are struggling to sell copies of the book have put a note up in the store saying they would rather donors hand in their vinyl instead. struggling note novel shop with up the hand copies. put been up in to week week been to who
